column3: ACK. I'm not seeing this on any key-servers though.\n
@theuni now it should be listed on the gpg keyservers:\nhttp://sks.spodhuis.org/pks/lookup?op=index&search=jonas.schnelli\n

```
gpg: key 522739F6: public key "Jonas Schnelli <jonas.schnelli@include7.ch>" imported
gpg: Total number processed: 1
gpg:               imported: 1  (RSA: 1)
```

I can't personally vouch that this is the real @jonasschnelli key, but at least now it's a single key. :)
Also can confirm this key verifies the gitian sigs under his name.\n

Message = "I can prove that my key is related to my github profile."

-----BEGIN PGP MESSAGE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.12 (GNU/Linux)

owEBdQKK/ZANAwACASJw4wxSJzn2AaxFYgdtZXNzYWdlVNYBPEkgY2FuIHByb3Zl
IHRoYXQgbXkga2V5IGlzIHJlbGF0ZWQgdG8gbXkgZ2l0aHViIHByb2ZpbGUuiQIc
BAABAgAGBQJU1gE8AAoJECJw4wxSJzn291AP/1tlY/qBZnvJyTurw3bYtAJkuKZX
tzr79DfOBBIJtgZnoDPk43CBQ/AThCyVxZ9gmoKea36QOnfLFBXKZFD//kVzC+v

That doesn't actually prove anything (other than what was already proven by you submitting the PR)? I'm not implying you need to do anything more to prove it's yours (although it'd be nice if someone verifies it when they meet you in person).\n

@luke-jr it just proves again that i'm holding the corresponding priv-key. But right, it was already obvious with the gitian sigs. But not in this repository.\nFeel free to fly over to Switzerland and have a coffee with me. :)\n
